Posts.Content: I'm clumsy too which is one of the reasons I hated having to remember to take my drain with me every time I moved.had a few near misses including my dozy Labrador trying to walk through the loop of dangling tube!i had mastectomy and chemo last year no radio and am 2 weeks post reconstruction .good luck with the rest of your treatment  Anne
Posts.Title: Hooray drain finally removed

Posts.Content: Thanks Sue.it had to be done he was dragging me down and stopping me from getting on with my life
Posts.Title: Hooray drain finally removed

Posts.Content: My silly husband things he's a comedian.because I no longer have Desmond in his bag i am bagless so I am now apparently called Dyson!do men ever grow up?he's 54
Posts.Title: Hooray drain finally removed

Posts.Content: Went to clinic again today.my silly drain was still misbehaving 50+ mls.i told the nurse i really wanted it out as it had been in 2 weeks and was an infection risk.lots of discussion with another nurse(they couldn't find a dr to ask!) and finally Desmond the drain was no more.feels really strange not having to remember to carry my little bag around but a relief.yeaah! Started back on tamoxifen today.boo! Sleep well lovely ladies  Anne
Posts.Title: Hooray drain finally removed

Posts.Content: Glad to be of service toxophilite.x
Posts.Title: Hooray drain finally removed

Posts.Content: Oh Jo that sounds like a painful divorce.i had a near miss when I still had both drains in a day after my second op(complications meant I went back to theatre 24 hours after first one)the nurse somehow managed to tangle them in the metal cot sides and when I tried to turn over in bed i was nearly parted from both before I realised what was happening and managed to sort myself out.that was painful so actually ripping it out including the stitch must have been awful.hope you get your waterlogged chest sorted out soon Anne
Posts.Title: Hooray drain finally removed

Posts.Content: I was just about to write something about tamoxifen when I saw this thread.i started tamoxifen this January and hate the awful leg pains insomnia and feeling generally knackered.have been off it 4 weeks,2 before 2 after surgery and am due to start it again now.i lay in bed last night wide awake and really fed up at the thought of going back on it as my legs have been much better these last couple of weeks.sometimes I really want to give up.never been given a percentage and as I don’t see anyone now except my breast surgeon for my reconstruction don’t know how I’d find out. By the way has anyone had ribs bruised /damaged during surgery?i have and it’s so painful but my breast surgeon seems to think it’s just one of those things  Anne  (oops that was a long winded message)
Posts.Title: Choosing whether to continue into another five years of hormone t...

Posts.Content: Hi Karen, it's easy to get an exemption certificate from your Gp.i got my little white exemption card back a week after sending the form off.as well as my tamoxifen I now get my asthma inhalers free which is great as I've always been a little bit peeved that I had to pay for them when I could die if I don't take them.sounds dramatic I know but I did 'die' once and had to be resuscitated so I have to take them daily.other 'necessary' drugs such as insulin are free so why not those that help keep the nasty C bug at bay? Anne
Posts.Title: Paying for Letrozole

Posts.Content: I was told I would have a 2 week wait for my mammogram results .i rang the BCN when I’d heard nothing.she told me I was clear and that  i should have been told 4 weeks  wait and the letter would  arrive soon.that was in May and I still haven’t had a letter
Posts.Title: Annual mammogram - how long for result

Posts.Content: Hi Jess I raised £365 with my coffee morning.my son took photos but they are rubbish
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Hi Bulldog mum I had a tissue expander put in in November 17 and I was in a lot of pain too. I didn’t realise at first it was the port but a consultant (my own wasn’t in clinic that day) was asked to see me as I was in so much pain.she examined me and I had a scan as a precaution.she said the port had damaged the lining of my ribs when it had been pushed in and that it could be as uncomfortable /painful as  actual broken ribs.it certainly felt it!unfortunately I had to put up with it and it was never really comfortable the whole time it was in.my surgeon wasn’t very sympathetic and no one seemed to realise how I felt. I really hope you’re pain improves soon and if not speak to your bcn or doctor.looking back I should have tried more to get something done.take care
Posts.Title: Post mastectomy and immediate reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Jess I did my first coffee morning 2 years ago because I thought it  would  be a nice way to raise money.by the time I did it last year I was one of the people who needed mcmilans services so although I wasn't very well I managed to do it again.this year I'm much better and there was no way I wouldn't have done it again Anne
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Hi Bulldog mum I had my tissue expander in for 13 months .i had a couple of cancellations after 11-12 months then finally had it removed on New Year’s Eve 2018(from Nov 17) and a permanent implant put in to go with  the LD flap I had had done in aug 17.the relief when that port was removed from my ribs was immense as it was uncomfortable and or painful every day it was in.because you say your pain is decreasing a little hopefully it is starting to improve already. I am crossing my fingers and toes for you as I would hate to think of you suffering for a long time.let me know how you get on.sending a gentle hug
Posts.Title: Post mastectomy and immediate reconstruction

Posts.Content: Morning Bulldog mum I could feel and see my port sitting a little below my breast.i had to wait for the ribs to recover before they could start the top ups.had first in January then third and final one in May.my bruising was bad but that was probably because of the damaged ribs. Having the top ups was fine just a needle into the port then saline put in.felt a little pressure but not painful and I was asked if it felt okay as it was slowly pushed in.they would have stopped if i felt uncomfortable  and would have just put a little in but I had no problems.think about 100mls in each time.
Posts.Title: Post mastectomy and immediate reconstruction

Posts.Content: Brilliant news
Posts.Title: The results are in!

Posts.Content: 30th is fine with me LondonLass.i couldn’t make the last one so really hoping to this time
Posts.Title: WHOSE READY FOR A MEET UP??

Posts.Content: Good luck for Wednesday.Try to be positive.Think of that special birthday celebration and give your twins extra hugs(and don't forget hubby )
Posts.Title: Awaiting breast biopsy results

Posts.Content: I don’t mind if we change to the 6th April
Posts.Title: WHOSE READY FOR A MEET UP??

Posts.Content: Hi Jillybean just wanted to add my own welcome to you.people like karen and Sal and other 'wise' ladies on this site are absolutely brilliant.you will always find someone who has been through or is going through the same sort of treatment as you do it's easy to get answers to any questions you have and when you are having a bad day the hugs  come thick and fast.joining here was one of the best things I have done since my diagnosis.look after yourself  Anne
Posts.Title: Recently been diagnosed, looking for support through my journey.

Posts.Content: Hi Flutterby i'm pretty useless with technology and can barely find my way round these things myself so hopefully someone will be along to help you better than I can.i do know you have to click on the old editor if you want to add photos
Posts.Title: Recently been diagnosed, looking for support through my journey.

Posts.Content: Well done.its such a relief when it's done isn't it?my hair was falling out in clumps by my 2nd chemo and it was awful seeing hair all over the pillows sofa etc so I told my husband to shave it off and wore hats/wig from then on. Have fun with scarves and hats and silly wigs if you feel like it.no one will be looking at you in public honestly they are too busy with their own lives  Anne
Posts.Title: I've done it! Shaved my head today...

Posts.Content: I had a similar conversation with a 'friend ' recently.she said it was time I pulled my finger out and got back to work! Anne
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Well she's always been one for opening her mouth without thinking so I wasn't entirely surprised.she's not a close friend and we usually only meet in a noisy group (at the baby/toddler groups I run) so I can cope with her.got some lovely friends who are always there if I need them Anne
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Happy Anniversary  to you and hubby seaspirit44
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: AnnJac I just wanted to pop on and say I’m sorry about your wound problem.You must be so fed up.I had problems with one of my wounds after my last surgery on 31/12 but though deep,it was only a small hole and after 10 weeks of twice weekly visits to clinic with me changing the dressing in between visits,it has now finally healed.they used Flaminol for the last couple of weeks and it finally did the trick. I really hope you can be sorted soon.Sending a hug from one Anne to another
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi kathleen37 just wanted to say welcome to thegroup no one wants to be in and to say that you’ll find lots of people who have lots of experience and knowledge to help you on here and they are a lovely bunch who will be there day and night whenever you need them
Posts.Title: Hello!!!

Posts.Content: So glad things seem to be improvingAnnJac
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,I have been on here before talking about reconstruction.i had pretty much decided that I would have the LD flap but now I'm not so sure.i was told i would have a slight weakness in my back which wouldn't be a problem unless I am very sporty.I'm not! Chatting to my son's friend recently and she said her mum has a lot of problems with her back following an LD flap.I am a childminder (my BCN knows this) and wh I am working again I will be picking babies/toddlers up constantly.In and out of high chairs,buggies,on and off changing tables etc.I am now worried that I wI'll struggle to work properly.sny one got any advice/experience ?I am also going to have a chat with friend 's mum as I've been given her number and an invitation to get in touch Anne
Posts.Title: Having second thoughts about type of reconstruction

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies.i will try and talk to that lady and also a friend of a friend who had the diep and has   said she would be happy to chat to me Anne
Posts.Title: Having second thoughts about type of reconstruction

Posts.Content: They've just rung back.rebooked for 9th August so not too long.i wish before they ring to cancel they would get the new date first.it wouldn't be as upsetting if they rang and said  this date is cancelled but we can do it on this date.much less stressful.i wouldn't have sat and eaten a load of chocolate with tears running down my face .oh well I'd better tell my family and friends it's on agai.for now!
Posts.Title: Cancelled surgery

Posts.Content: just had a call from the hospital.my reconstruction booked for next Wednesday has been cancelled due to too many emergencies.feeling really sad and fed up but as I was one of those newly diagnosed ladies needing surgery last year I shouldn't really complain.suppose it's better than cancelling on the morning of my op
Posts.Title: Cancelled surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Jo,I agree with you that making a decision about what type of reconstruction if any is difficul.i was sure I knew what I wanted but now I want to have more information before I decide.if I have the LD then find out later that I can't do my job properly I would be really upset.also, as I am self employed I have to think about the financial side of things.Hopefully I will be able to make a more informed decision soon though some days,today is one of them, I just think sod it I'll stay as I am.good luck to anyone going down this road at the moment. Anne
Posts.Title: Having second thoughts about type of reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi,I went to Rome last month(present from my lovely children who knew it would give me something to look forward to post chemo).i carried on as normal with My tamoxifen and was absolutely fine.have a wonderful time  Snne
Posts.Title: Flying while on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Londonlass Sal I understand how you feel I’m sure we’re all upset and frustrated about the thread being locked but fingers crossed it will be back soon.as you say we are all here for each other and hopefully the moderators will see that this incident is just a blip on what has always been a wonderful caring means of support to many of us.big hug. I’d send you some smarties if I had any
Posts.Title: GREAT TIMING......

Posts.Content: Toxophilite/Karen thanks for my hugs sending some back to you.sorry you had to put up with what’s gone on.drive safely,don’t work too hard
Posts.Title: GREAT TIMING......

Posts.Content: Toxophilite/Karen thanks for my hugs sending some back to you.sorry you had to put up with what’s gone on.drive safely,don’t work too hard
Posts.Title: GREAT TIMING......

Posts.Content: Hi my oncotype results were in the middle too.i decided to go with chemo as I wanted to do everything possible to increase my chances.Also the consultant said if it was her she would go for it and I thought she obviously knows all the pros and cons so... Chemo wasn't great I won't lie but nor was it as awful as I thought it would be. Hope this helps  Anne
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: Good luck for tomorrow zizza Anne
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result - just need to vent

Posts.Content: Hi Pearl,it's nice to hear from a fellow waitee.sorry your wait is even longer than mine..I am trying not to think about it too much,just have a little wobble whenever I hear the post arrive.Like you say,if it is back then we'll just have to get on with it.I'll keep in touch and let you know when I finally hear something.Lets keep strong for each other and anyone else waiting  Anne
Posts.Title: Still waiting for mammogram results

Posts.Content: Back for another moan!i was sure my mammogram results would be here by now as it's 2 weeks tomorrow and they said 1-2 weeks.the postman has been and yet again there was post for me,not hubby or son, so I picked it up with a slightly shaky hand but no.not my results.i've never been a panicker but I am now.i don't want my family to realise how freaked out I am,hence the letting off steam to you lovely ladies Anne
Posts.Title: Still waiting for mammogram results

Posts.Content: Good luck for tomorrow zizza Anne
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result - just need to vent

Posts.Content: Trying to speak to a Gp at my practice is harder than getting an audience with the Pope!i will give it until Friday then might try ringing the clinic.just had my nephew and his wife and gorgeous girls visit me out of the blue.got lots of lovely cuddles and baby kisses.cheered me up a lot Anne
Posts.Title: Still waiting for mammogram results

Posts.Content: i've been telling my family that no news is good news as I had a letter within a week last year when  had my routine mammogram which started all this nightmare
Posts.Title: Still waiting for mammogram results

Posts.Content: Still no post so I rang the BCN team.Just got a call back and said letter will come soon and everything is ok!Phew!!So why am I crying like an idiot? Anne
Posts.Title: Still waiting for mammogram results

Posts.Content: Thank you.yes it's my first year.i really didn't think I would be so worked up about it but my friend warned me that she still won't open her results even after 10 years and gets her husband to do it so I know I'm not alone .might have a glass of wine tonight. Anne
Posts.Title: Still waiting for mammogram results

Posts.Content: Hi Debs64 yes I do know Mike.normally he stands with the Bass and Tenors and I am in the middle with the Sltos when we are rehearsing/performing.We just happened to be put in that position on the stage.Are you in Manchester?
Posts.Title: Cold Feet (The TV programme not the things on the end of your legs...

Posts.Content: Debs64 I live in Didsbury so not far from Maggie’s’s and Christies.You don’t need to have a good voice to join the choir.we just sing because we enjoy it and Carol our wonderful choir director can get  a good sound out of anybody
Posts.Title: Cold Feet (The TV programme not the things on the end of your legs...

Posts.Content: I’ve only just noticed the ‘.Cold Feet’ thread.I agree that some of the scenes like the silly anaesthetist effects and quick recovery from chemo were a bit strange but I know that they did consult with breast cancer staff when making the programme.One of the writers of the episodes dealing with the cancer story line is a friend of my choir director and that’s partly the reason in a round about way that my choir ended up being in it!I’ll try and post a photo of us with Faye and the other actors
Posts.Title: Cold Feet (The TV programme not the things on the end of your legs...

Posts.Content: I’m in the back row third from the left
Posts.Title: Cold Feet (The TV programme not the things on the end of your legs...

Posts.Content: I have just had an LD flap reconstruction.had left mastectomy June 2016 and chemo.i originally thought it was one op but when I saw the surgeon he said it was 2.they fit the flap and put a tissue expander in then 4/6 months later remove the expander put in an implant (apparently back muscle alone doesn't give a good enough shape) and give the other boob a lift in same op.i had first stage in August but unfortunately I developed a problem post op so they had to remove the expander and some of the flap so I will be having that put right before the second stage can be done.i think it depends on the surgeon/hospital whether it's one procedure or two as some people seem to have had it all done in one go.
Posts.Title: Delayed reconstruction after bilateral mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thank you Gay.the dr has just been and hopefully home tomorrow
Posts.Title: Post op LD flap causing problems

Posts.Content: Ha ha that is one freaky nurse Gay
Posts.Title: Post op LD flap causing problems

Posts.Content: Hi ladies,hope you've all had some sleep.impossible in this ward.anyway had my op on Wednesday everything seemed ok.thurs 6am nurse tells me don't eat or drink your consultant is coming to see you.turns out they were worried about the blood supply but hadn't told me cos they didn't want me worrying during the night.anyway I went back to theatre prepared for possible removal of flap.i was gutted.when they opened me up again things weren't too bad,small blood clots.hopefully all sorted now but they want me to stay in for a few days to keep an eye on things.wish my luck would go the right way for once.oh well,might try and nap again for a while as I'm shattered despite 2 anaesthetic sleeps in 2 days Anne
Posts.Title: Post op LD flap causing problems

Posts.Content: Hi,I've had lots of insensitive remarks including several tales about someone related to them who was just like me .when I ask how they are now I get'oh she died'!i get angry but I wonder sometimes if when they walk away,they realise what they have said and are embarrassed.after all ,we've all said stupid things at times so I try not to let it bother me.i know that's not always easy especially on 'a bad day'.good luck eith your recovery.i'm a childminder so picking up babies is my job which I hope to get back too soon
Posts.Title: Your cancer wasn't bad then....

Posts.Content: Wow!I can forgive people saying tactless things due to ignorance but an anaesthetist just before surgery?Absolutely unbelievable!as an ex nurse I've met some Drs with a dreadful bedside manner but that one beats them all
Posts.Title: Your cancer wasn't bad then....

Posts.Content: Ha ha.that registrar is unbelievable.surely she realised what she'd said straightaway?if not,she needs to rethink her career choice.
Posts.Title: Your cancer wasn't bad then....

Posts.Content: im having LD flap surgery on 9th August and am getting a bit worried after reading about you poor ladies.i am self employed (childminder) and need to be fit to work after a reasonable recovery period .i am having the surgery done in two stages with a 4-6 month gap.did you have it done this way? Anne
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Sorry I didn't explain myself very well.i had a mastectomy last June .my consultant said he the LD flap is done in 2 stages although that's not how it was explained to me by the BCN who went through the various types of surgery with me.
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: No it's nothing to do with a nipple that hasn't even been mentioned yet and I'm not sure I'll bother with it anyway.the way I understand it,the back muscle will be put in place and also a tissue expander.the second part is to put in an implant .they said that as back muscle is quite rigid an implant helps with a better shape.don't know what else they might do.i will also be having the other boob lifted at the second op.hope that makes sense Sue
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Ooh.i was going to ask if anyone had any tips about comfort in bed etc.v shaped pillow?mskes sense.i shall get one thanks for that Sue.i will keep you up to date with my progress and hopefully anyone heading down this route can see how it is
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: I'm beginning to wish I'd decided on the DIEP now.i thought the LD would be a quicker  recovery time and less drastic!think I may be wrong there! Anne
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Thanks Sue.i'm 54 by the way so not young :)
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Thanks Sue Anne
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Hi Lou1234 just a quick message to say hello and welcome
Posts.Title: Hello, I’m new to this and would love a friendly hello

Posts.Content: I had 3 doxataxels with 3 week gaps.the first was horrendous with all the symptoms you're suffering from but the next 2 ,though not great,were not as bad.still had very painful legs and feet but regular painkillers helped.hope you find things get easier soon Anne
Posts.Title: Taxol (do not know the full name)

Posts.Content: I’ve just been put on vit D following a diagnosis of osteoporosis.saw the Gp today and asked did I need any blood tests as I didn’t know if my levels were low or high.she said if they tested everyone in Manchester at this time of year most would be low!.however she decided I should have a test done then depending on results she could adjust my dosage.wouldn’t it be cheaper for the nhs if I had the test first as if I need to change drugs then I will have to throw the pack I have now.seems silly to me. I had to laugh when she looked at me and said I look like I get plenty of vit D from being outdoors. I’m pale and totally unfit.the opposite of an outdoorsy type though I used to be out everyday with school runs/parks,garden as a childminder and walking my dog twice a day.now I just manage a couple of short school runs a week and am trying to build up my dog walking.can only do about 1/2 hour at the moment.
Posts.Title: vitamin D - who knows their vitamin D levels are low ?

Posts.Content: Hi Baileybelle I too have struggled with the bra problem as I have always worn pretty matching sets before.At M &S I got the boring black and white ones but also a very pretty blue flowery one.sadly that was the only nice one.Debenhams have a few matching sets in pink blue purple cream and red as well as the 'beigy ' ones.i have them all but would love some new ones to be added.good luck
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras!

Posts.Content: That's great news.how nice of your BCN to ring you.you mentioned your eyes.can chemo affect your eyes?
Posts.Title: Job lot
